result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grahm T Haferman

records.addlTxt: Status conference on April 24, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Parties have not been able to reach an agreement and request trial dates at least 90 days out. The CM case is to be set with the CF case FPT.

Parties are still working towards a resolution. DE has a CF case that is going to prelim next week. Atty O'Connell advised the address on file is up to date for now. DE given notice in hand for next hearing.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Hearing for 7-15-2022 1:30pm Pre-trial Conference, copies of Bail/Bonds, UW Ban Area, and State Public Defender info sheet returned as undeliverable, mail not picked up.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be on any University of Wisconsin-Madison property as defined by the attached map except only for business-related purposes. 
Trial Judge - Br 17 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

10:05 AM Defendant appeared.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
